name: Muse OLED Séance Design System
description: Locked-in design tokens for the Muse haunted morphing filter. Mint phosphor on pure black - authentic 1989 CRT aesthetic. This is the final vision. DO NOT DEVIATE.

philosophy.core: Haunted hardware from 1989. Conduct a séance with geometry. Mint phosphor glow on void-black background.
rules: Smooth vector graphics - no chunky blocks
Interactive and responsive - modern UX with retro aesthetic
Clean and minimal - let the mouth do the talking

background.description: Pure black. No gradients. The void.

phosphor.description: P1 phosphor green. Authentic CRT display color. Maximum contrast, minimal eye strain.

colors.rationale: 19.8:1 contrast ratio. Historically accurate P1 phosphor. Distinctive in plugin market. Reduces eye fatigue in dark studios.

controls.description: Left side: 3 interactive knobs (MORPH, INTENSITY, MIX)

display.description: Right side: Large mouth visualization responding to formant changes

mouth.morphing: Hardware snap at 10 FPS (not smooth interpolation)
mouth.behavior: Snaps between vowel shapes with slight delay - creates haunted, mechanical feel
mouth.description: The mouth is the visualization. Wide open (AA) → neutral (AH) → narrow smile (EE). Updates at 10 FPS for authentic 1989 hardware stutter.

scanlines.description: Optional - can add if needed for more retro feel

frame_rate.description: UI runs at 60 FPS for smooth interaction, but mouth updates at 10 FPS for authentic 1989 hardware stutter. This creates the 'haunted' snap effect.

mouth_stutter.behavior: Hardware snap - mouth shape snaps between vowel positions instead of smooth interpolation
mouth_stutter.rationale: Creates visceral, slightly unsettling motion that feels mechanical and otherworldly. This is NOT a bug - it's authentic 1989 CRT behavior.

immutable_rules: Smooth vector mouth, not pixel grid
This is the vision. Ship it.
